basic.description:
An in-depth study of the biophysical properties of neurons and diseases that affect the function of neurons and glia. Topics will include cable properties of dendrites, voltage- and ligand-dependent channels, and molecular mechanisms responsible for neuronal death and regeneration. The course will be based on lectures and student seminars of selected readings. 
NOTE    BMCO students should contact the Department regarding prerequisites.
basic.subject: NSCI
basic.title: Cellular and Molecular Neuroscience

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite    (A grade of B in NSCI 322 or LISC 322 or NSCI 323 or NSC 324) and (Level 4 and registration in the LISC Major or Specialization Plan) and (a GPA of 2.5) or permission of the course coordinator.
